info.author: Rob Tillotson
classifiers: Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
Byline is a weblog authoring tool that uses the XML-RPC APIs found in popular
        weblog systems to allow you to write weblog entries on your desktop in your
        favorite editor.  It tries to support all of the features of every weblog CMS it
        is compatible with; currently Blogger, Movable Type, and Nucleus are explicitly
        supported and other systems that are compatible with the Blogger or MetaWeblog
        APIs may also work.  Byline features for weblog authors include structured text,
        Cheetah templating, Amazon.com web services support, drafts, and trackback URL
        discovery.  Some parts of Byline may also be useful to other Python applications
        that communicate with weblog servers.
info.name: Byline
info.html_description:
Byline is a weblog authoring tool that uses the XML-RPC APIs found in popular
weblog systems to allow you to write weblog entries on your desktop in your favorite editor. It tries to support all of the features of every weblog CMS it is compatible with; currently Blogger, Movable Type, and Nucleus are explicitly supported and other systems that are compatible with the Blogger or MetaWeblog APIs may also work. Byline features for weblog authors include structured text, Cheetah templating, Amazon.com web services support, drafts, and trackback URL discovery. Some parts of Byline may also be useful to other Python applications that communicate with weblog servers.
